summary: DHS's Securing the Cities program seeks to give state and local agencies the ability to detect and deter nuclear terrorism, including dirty bombs. It provides funding for equipment, such as radiation detectors, and training for up to 5 years. Participating cities are required to submit plans and show potential future funding sources for sustaining these programs after DHS funding ends. We found DHS does not...
title: Combating Nuclear Terrorism: DHS Should Address Limitations to Its Program to Secure Key Cities
